Apple___Apple_scab.description: Fungal disease causing dark, scabby lesions on apple leaves and fruit, reducing quality and yield.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays during wet periods
Rake and destroy fallen leaves in autumn
Prune trees to improve air circulation
Choose resistant apple varieties for future plantings
Apply lime sulfur spray during dormant season
Avoid overhead irrigation on foliage

Apple___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease causing circular brown lesions on apple leaves and dark, sunken cankers on fruit.
remedies: Remove and destroy infected fruit and branches
Apply copper-based fungicides during growing season
Prune dead and diseased wood during dormant season
Improve air circulation through proper pruning
Clean up fallen fruit and leaves
Apply preventive sprays from petal fall to harvest

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Fungal disease requiring both apple and juniper trees, causing yellow spots on apple leaves and orange lesions on fruit.
remedies: Remove nearby juniper trees if possible (alternate host)
Apply preventive fungicide sprays in early spring
Plant rust-resistant apple varieties
Prune to improve air circulation
Apply protective sprays during wet spring weather
Remove infected leaves and fruit promptly

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: Fungal disease creating white powdery coating on cherry leaves, shoots, and fruit, reducing photosynthesis.
remedies: Apply sulfur-based fungicides or horticultural oils
Prune for better air circulation
Remove infected shoots and leaves immediately
Avoid overhead watering during fruit development
Apply preventive sprays before symptoms appear
Use resistant cherry varieties when replanting

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: Fungal disease causing rectangular gray-brown lesions on corn leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
remedies: Plant resistant corn hybrids
Rotate crops away from corn for 2-3 years
Apply foliar fungicides if disease pressure is high
Maintain proper plant spacing for air circulation
Till under crop residue after harvest
Monitor weather conditions for disease development

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Fungal disease causing reddish-brown pustules on corn leaves, most severe in cool, humid conditions.
remedies: Plant rust-resistant corn hybrids
Apply triazole fungicides if severe infection occurs
Monitor weather conditions for disease pressure
Ensure balanced nutrition, especially potassium
Remove volunteer corn plants from previous season
Scout fields regularly during cool, humid periods

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Fungal disease causing elongated gray-green lesions on corn leaves, reducing grain quality and yield.
remedies: Plant resistant corn varieties
Rotate with non-host crops for 2-3 years
Apply foliar fungicides at first sign of disease
Till under crop residue after harvest
Maintain proper plant population density
Scout fields regularly during humid conditions

Grape___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease affecting grapes, causing dark spots on leaves and mummified berries.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays from bud break
Remove mummified berries and infected canes
Improve vineyard air circulation through pruning
Avoid overhead irrigation during fruit development
Apply lime sulfur spray during dormant season
Remove infected leaves and fruit debris

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: Complex fungal disease causing leaf discoloration, berry shrivel, and internal wood decay in grapevines.
remedies: Remove and destroy infected wood during dormant pruning
Apply wound protectants after pruning cuts
Improve vine nutrition and water management
Avoid large pruning cuts when possible
Apply trunk treatments with systemic fungicides
Remove infected berries and leaves during growing season

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Fungal disease causing brown spots with yellow halos on grape leaves, leading to defoliation.
remedies: Apply copper-based fungicides preventively
Improve air circulation through canopy management
Remove infected leaves and debris
Avoid overhead irrigation late in the day
Apply protective sprays during wet periods
Maintain proper vine spacing for air movement

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Bacterial disease transmitted by Asian citrus psyllid, causing yellowing, bitter fruit, and tree decline.
remedies: Control Asian citrus psyllid vectors with insecticides
Remove and destroy infected trees immediately
Plant disease-free certified nursery stock
Apply nutritional sprays to support tree health
Monitor regularly for early detection
Implement area-wide psyllid control programs

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial disease causing small dark spots on peach leaves and fruit, reducing fruit quality.
remedies: Apply copper bactericide sprays preventively
Use pathogen-free nursery stock
Prune for good air circulation
Avoid overhead irrigation during fruit development
Remove infected fruit and leaves
Apply protective sprays before and after rain events

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial disease causing small dark spots on pepper leaves and fruit, reducing marketability.
remedies: Use pathogen-free seeds and transplants
Apply copper bactericide sprays preventively
Avoid overhead irrigation and working when plants are wet
Rotate crops with non-solanaceous plants
Remove infected plant debris
Use drip irrigation instead of sprinklers

Potato___Early_blight.description: Fungal disease causing concentric ring spots on potato leaves, starting with older foliage.
remedies: Apply chlorothalonil or copper-based fungicides
Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash
Water at soil level, not on foliage
Remove lower leaves that touch the ground
Rotate crops annually with non-solanaceous plants
Maintain proper plant nutrition, especially nitrogen

Potato___Late_blight.description: Devastating oomycete disease causing dark lesions on potato plants and tuber rot.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays in humid conditions
Plant certified disease-free seed potatoes
Ensure good drainage and air circulation
Remove volunteer potatoes and infected plants
Monitor weather conditions for disease-favorable periods
Harvest tubers in dry conditions and cure properly

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: Fungal disease creating white powdery coating on squash leaves, reducing photosynthesis and fruit quality.
remedies: Apply sulfur-based fungicides or neem oil spray
Increase air circulation around plants
Avoid overhead watering - water at soil level
Remove infected leaves immediately
Apply baking soda solution (1 tsp per quart water)
Plant resistant squash varieties

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Fungal disease causing irregular brown blotches on strawberry leaves, leading to leaf drop.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays during wet periods
Remove and destroy infected leaves and runners
Improve air circulation through proper spacing
Avoid overhead irrigation late in the day
Apply mulch to prevent soil splash
Plant resistant strawberry varieties

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial disease causing small dark spots on tomato leaves and fruit, reducing yield and quality.
remedies: Use pathogen-free seeds and transplants
Apply copper bactericide sprays preventively
Avoid overhead irrigation and working when plants are wet
Rotate crops with non-solanaceous plants
Remove infected plant debris
Use drip irrigation instead of overhead sprinklers

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Fungal disease causing concentric ring spots on older tomato leaves, progressing upward.
remedies: Apply chlorothalonil or copper-based fungicides
Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash
Water at soil level, not on foliage
Remove lower leaves that touch the ground
Rotate crops annually with non-solanaceous plants
Stake plants to improve air circulation

Tomato___Late_blight.description: Devastating oomycete disease causing dark lesions on tomato plants with white fungal growth.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays in humid conditions
Ensure good drainage and air circulation
Remove infected plants immediately
Avoid overhead watering
Monitor weather conditions for disease development
Use resistant tomato varieties when available

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Fungal disease causing yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces with olive-green mold underneath.
remedies: Improve greenhouse ventilation and reduce humidity
Apply preventive fungicide sprays
Remove infected leaves immediately
Avoid overhead watering
Maintain proper plant spacing
Use resistant tomato varieties in protected cultivation

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Fungal disease causing small circular spots with dark borders and light centers on tomato leaves.
remedies: Apply copper-based or chlorothalonil fungicides
Remove infected lower leaves and debris
Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash
Water at soil level to keep foliage dry
Rotate crops with non-solanaceous plants
Stake plants for better air circulation

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Tiny arachnid pests causing stippling, yellowing, and webbing on tomato leaves.
remedies: Increase humidity around plants with frequent misting
Apply insecticidal soap or neem oil spray
Introduce predatory mites as biological control
Remove heavily infested leaves
Avoid dusty conditions and over-fertilization
Use reflective mulches to deter mites

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Fungal disease causing circular spots with concentric rings on tomato leaves and fruit.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays containing chlorothalonil
Remove infected plant debris and lower leaves
Improve air circulation through proper spacing
Avoid overhead irrigation
Rotate crops with non-solanaceous plants
Apply mulch to prevent soil splash

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Viral disease transmitted by whiteflies, causing leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth.
remedies: Control whitefly vectors with insecticides or yellow sticky traps
Use virus-resistant tomato varieties
Remove infected plants immediately
Install fine mesh screens in greenhouses
Apply reflective mulches to deter whiteflies
Eliminate weeds that harbor whiteflies

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Viral disease causing mottled patterns, leaf distortion, and reduced fruit quality in tomatoes.
remedies: Use virus-free seeds and transplants
Disinfect tools and hands between plants
Remove infected plants immediately
Control aphid vectors with appropriate insecticides
Avoid tobacco use around tomato plants
Implement strict sanitation practices

Apple Scab.description: Fungal disease causing dark, scabby lesions on apple leaves and fruit.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays during wet periods
Rake and destroy fallen leaves in autumn
Prune trees to improve air circulation
Choose resistant apple varieties for future plantings
Apply lime sulfur spray during dormant season

Fire Blight.description: Bacterial disease that causes branches to appear burned, affecting apple and pear trees.
remedies: Prune infected branches 12 inches below visible symptoms
Disinfect pruning tools with 10% bleach solution
Apply copper bactericide during bloom period
Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilization
Remove water sprouts and suckers regularly

Powdery Mildew.description: White powdery fungal growth on leaves and stems, weakening the plant and reducing yield.
remedies: Apply sulfur-based fungicide or neem oil spray
Increase air circulation around plants
Avoid overhead watering - water at soil level
Remove infected leaves immediately
Apply baking soda solution (1 tsp per quart water)

Black Rot.description: Fungal disease affecting grapes, causing dark spots on leaves and fruit rot.
remedies: Apply preventive fungicide sprays from bud break
Remove mummified berries and infected canes
Improve vineyard air circulation through pruning
Avoid overhead irrigation during fruit development
Apply lime sulfur spray during dormant season

Downy Mildew.description: Fungal-like disease causing yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces and fuzzy growth underneath.

Improve air circulation and reduce humidity
Water early in the day to allow leaves to dry
Remove infected plant material immediately
Use drip irrigation instead of overhead sprinklers

Citrus Canker.description: Bacterial disease causing raised lesions on citrus leaves, stems, and fruit.
remedies: Apply copper bactericide sprays regularly
Prune and destroy infected branches
Avoid working with plants when wet
Implement windbreaks to reduce bacterial spread
Quarantine new plants before introducing to grove

Greening.description: Bacterial disease transmitted by insects, causing yellowing and bitter fruit in citrus.

Remove and destroy infected trees immediately
Plant disease-free certified nursery stock
Apply nutritional sprays to support tree health
Monitor regularly for early detection

Brown Rot.description: Fungal disease causing fruit rot and blossom blight in stone fruits.

Remove mummified fruit from trees and ground
Prune for good air circulation
Avoid wounding fruit during harvest
Store harvested fruit in cool, dry conditions

Bacterial Spot.description: Bacterial disease causing small, dark spots on leaves and fruit of peppers and tomatoes.

Use pathogen-free seeds and transplants
Avoid overhead irrigation and working when plants are wet

Plant certified disease-free seed potatoes
Ensure good drainage and air circulation
Remove volunteer potatoes and infected plants

Early Blight.description: Fungal disease causing concentric ring spots on older leaves of tomatoes and potatoes.

Water at soil level, not on foliage
Remove lower leaves that touch the ground

Harvest fruit before full ripeness if disease pressure is high

Mosaic Virus.description: Viral disease causing mottled, mosaic-like patterns on leaves and stunted plant growth.

Use virus-resistant plant varieties
Disinfect tools between plants

Ensure good air circulation through pruning
Remove and destroy infected plant debris
Avoid overhead watering
Harvest fruits before full ripeness if disease is present

Frogeye Leaf Spot.description: Fungal disease in soybeans causing circular spots with gray centers and dark borders.

Apply foliar fungicides if severe
Rotate crops to break disease cycle
Till under crop residue

Rust.description: Fungal disease causing orange to reddish-brown pustules on leaves.

Plant rust-resistant varieties
